So they are... they are fixed at those low levels. And then what happens when we have such high debt levels? Well, all these boomers are in money market funds, and as rates go up, they earn more interest income. So this is going into money market funds. This is why you see charts where it's just... like money market fund flows are just like up and to the right. So that money goes into there, and then they rebalance it because, you know, these are that income class. Their marginal propensity to consume is... is not that high when they get an additional dollar. They're just going to invest into other things. So the rebalance... that rebalancing is not happening into onchain tokens. You know, these are... these are boomers. It's... it's rebalancing into stocks. So this is why equities just keep grinding up higher and higher and higher. And this is why I think valuations is just the wrong thing to anchor yourself to in this dynamic. It's a flows thing. It's a lack of other options thing. And overall, just to circle back to your question is that there's just... there's no mechanical move towards that into altcoins. That's just this side capital, and anything that can be close to that, i.e., you know, these treasury treasury companies, Bitcoin ETF, there's obviously still the Ethereum ETF, which gets some of it, but that's where the marginal dollar does go when it goes out the further out the risk curve, but it just... there's no linkage to altcoins to onchain.
